main.description: Pen Tester. Software Developer. System Admin.
main.bio: I am a senior at New Mexico Institute of Mining and Technology pursing a bachelor and master of science in Computer Science with a focus in cybersecurity. My interests include rootkits, user authentication technologies, security audits, and software exploitation. When I am not working on cybersecurity related work, I am either reconfiguring servers at home, programming, dirt biking, or on a search and rescue mission.

work.title: Technical Intern
description: Developed attack vectors and completed preliminary analysis during a voting machine audit. Worked to explore potential attack vectors with team of cybersecurity researchers.

work.title: Software Engineer
description: Debugging a parallel 3D finite-element solver that couples groundwater flow, heat, and transport equations.
Maintains multiple high performance computers. Provides regular updates and support for a multiple systems running different Linux and Windows operating systems.

Inherited a previously developed software solution that calculates the density of water based on temperature and pressure. Converted the code from FORTRAN to MATLAB to use the solvers present in MATLAB. This enabled other faculty members to use the equation of state code in their own programs.
Converted MATLAB code that calculated the stress on ice sheets to FORTRAN. This was to increase the speed of the calculations by decreasing the overhead of running the library in MATLAB.

projects.title: Sundial (Work In Progress)
projects.description: Sundial is software designed to help manage time and tasks. It provides a simple user interface that enables users to keep on task throughout their day. Sundial will prioritize tasks so that the nearest deadline is at the top of the list. This application is continuously subjected to redesigns with new user interfaces and new libraries. Sundial is used as a testing ground for new technologies.

projects.title: House Infrastructure
projects.description: I am using Ubuntu (next time will be CentOS) as my base operating system and a hypervisor. I am using a virtualized pfSense as my router. pfSense provides DHCP, DNS, OpenVPN, and more services for my home network. On the same physical machine, connected via a virtual bridge, I use lxc containers for Unifi controller and Plex media server. I plan to use lxc containers to provide DHCP and DNS instead of using pfSense. This will allow the network to function if pfSense fails.

projects.title: 1975 Honda CB200T Rebuild
projects.description: I am working on my first motorcycle rebuild project. It is a 1975 Honda CB200T motorcycle. I am using this project to learn more about vehicle rebuilds. Currently, I am finishing the electrical system on the motorcycle.

projects.title: Reference Monitor with xv6 (Work In Progress)
projects.description: xv6 is a unix-like that is used to teach operating systems. My semester project for the graduate level operating systems class is to implemenet a reference monitor within the xv6 operating system. This project is being completed this semester and I'll provide updates as more progress is completed.

projects.title: AuctionBoost
projects.description: AuctionBoost is software that is used for managing the check-in and check-out process at auctions. It enables organizations to provide quicker and more professional service to their guests. The software is capable of tracking guests and items throughout an auction. When guests first sign in on this software, they are given a bid card number as described by the auction's settings inside the software. When the guests check out, they can know what they bought right away – auctions no longer need to use other data sheet software to track their auction.
